metadata.title: CVE-2018-5101 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when manipulating floating"first-letter" style elements, resulting in a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
